sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Israeli military pounds the Gaza Strip including the densely populated south after the breakdown of a truce that both sides blame on each other.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UN Children's Agency describes the assault on Gaza as a war on children, saying more than 5,000 have already been killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: To phase down or phase out, the battle over fossil fuels is underway at the COP28 summit in Dubai.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Israeli flares over Gaza's southern city of Khan Yunus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There's been a night of bombardment in the Palestinian enclave after the week-long truce between Israel and the militant group Hamas collapsed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: enclave after the week-long truce between Israel and the militant group Hamas collapsed. Both sides blame the other for wrecking the negotiations and triggering the resumption of hostilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Israel has also expanded its operation further south, where many Palestinians have been sheltering because of fighting in the north.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Palestinian officials say over 180 people have been killed and almost 600 others injured in the renewed airstrikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Humanitarian organizations say Israeli forces are preventing desperately needed aid trucks from entering Gaza and have called for their immediate resumption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in the United States, hundreds of pro-Palestinian demonstrators gathered outside the Israeli embassy in Washington demanding a ceasefire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UN Children's Agency, UNICEF, has called it a war on children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It says more than 5,000 have already been killed and thousands more injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: One reason for that high rate is that children make up around 40% of the population in Gaza. Another is that it's a very densely populated area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We cannot see more children with the wounds of war, with the burns, with the shrapnel littering their body, with the broken bones. Inaction by those with influence is allowing the killing of children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is a war on children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Over 1.7 million Gazans have had to flee their homes, roughly half of them children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now they don't have enough clean water, food, fuel or medicine and they also remain trapped inside the Gaza Strip, as all the border crossings into either Egypt or Israel are effectively closed to them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: World leaders meeting at the United Nations COP28 climate change conference in Dubai say

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: they know the planet is overheating and have pledged to do what they can to keep it from getting worse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron urged the world's richest nations to end the use of coal by 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The most emitting countries must now enter into this logic of ecological planning and transparency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And in this respect, the G7 has a major responsibility, just like China, which is now the second most emitting country in history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And while most agree that the key to limiting global warming is to reduce the use of fossil fuels, difficult negotiations lie ahead about just how far to go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The conference president has called for the phase down of coal, oil and gas, but that falls short of the full phase out that dozens of nations say they want to see.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia's main opposition leader Alexei Navalny is already serving a 30-year sentence for crimes including extremism, which are widely viewed as politically motivated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now at 47, he's been charged with more offences, this time in the penal code concerning vandalism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Before he was arrested in 2021, Navalny was best known for campaigning against official corruption and organising large protests against President Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Whilst in prison, he's frequently being held in solitary confinement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Whilst in prison, he's frequently being held in solitary confinement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Italian airline Alitalia says it plans to fire some 2,700 workers who had been placed on temporary layoffs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Italy's bankrupt former flank carrier officially ceased operations in 2021 and is in the process of liquidation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In May, German airline Lufthansa agreed to take a 41% stake in ITER Airways, a new airline spun off from Alitalia for 325 million euros.
